ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] state directory
ygData.msgSnippet: All .JDB files are part of BDB-JE environment and needed while the crawl is running. Once the crawl finishes, they can be discarded if you won t be resuming

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] state directory

X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

All .JDB files are part of BDB-JE environment and needed while the crawl 
is running. Once the crawl finishes, they can be discarded if you won't 
be resuming any checkpoints from the crawl (or, in rare cases, doing 
other deep inspection of the ending crawl state).

The BDB environment holds all queued-for-collection URIs, persistent 
state for known Hosts/Servers/Queues, and (unless the BloomUriUniqFilter 
is in use) the record of already-seen URIs. It could only be slimmed 
down by shrinking one of those structures.

If there are a number of gigantic queues with unwanted URIs and still 
growing -- essentially, crawler traps -- then adding mid-crawl settings 
changes to stop adding new URIs to those queues, and reject without 
collection those already scheduled, might offer some reduction in 
on-disk size.

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/20/10 11:50 PM, Mahmoud Mubarak wrote:
>
> What about .JDB files? I have now about 12500 .jdb file with 115G. Logs
> directory size is about 30G. My concern still exists about growing disk
> usage (~ 95%). Any suggestions about this issue?
>
